trans-unit.source: Provides methods and properties to manage and query the toolbox in the development environment.

The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService> interface provides properties and methods for adding and removing toolbox items and toolbox creator callback delegates, serializing and deserializing toolbox items, and retrieving toolbox state information and managing toolbox state.
You can retrieve information about the contents of the toolbox with the following methods:
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.CategoryNames%2A> property indicates the categories currently available on the toolbox.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.SelectedCategory%2A> property indicates the currently selected toolbox category.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.GetToolboxItems%2A> method retrieves the items on the toolbox, optionally filtered by a specified toolbox category.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.GetSelectedToolboxItem%2A> method retrieves the currently selected <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.SetSelectedToolboxItem%2A> method selects the specified <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> as the current toolbox item.

The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.IsSupported%2A> method indicates whether the specified serialized object, if it is a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>, is supported by the specified designer host, or whether it matches the specified attributes.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.IsToolboxItem%2A> method indicates whether the specified serialized object is a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>.
You can add and remove toolbox items with the following methods:

The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.AddToolboxItem%2A> method adds a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> to the toolbox, creating the optionally specified category if it does not exist.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.AddLinkedToolboxItem%2A> method adds a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> that is only enabled for the current project to the toolbox.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.RemoveToolboxItem%2A> method removes the specified <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>.

The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.AddCreator%2A> method adds a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCreatorCallback> delegate capable of converting some type of data stored on the toolbox to a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.RemoveCreator%2A> method removes any <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCreatorCallback> delegates for the specified data type.
You can refresh the toolbox, mark a toolbox item as used, or set the mouse cursor to a cursor that represents the current toolbox item using the following methods:
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.Refresh%2A> method refreshes the toolbox display to reflect the current state of the toolbox items.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.SelectedToolboxItemUsed%2A> method signals the toolbox that the selected toolbox item has been used.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.SetCursor%2A> method sets the mouse cursor to a cursor that represents the current toolbox item.
You can use the toolbox to serialize or deserialize a toolbox item using the following methods:
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.DeserializeToolboxItem%2A> method attempts to return a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> from the specified serialized toolbox item object.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.SerializeToolboxItem%2A> method returns a serialized object representing the specified <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>.
Adds a new toolbox item creator for a specified data format.
A toolbox item creator can convert data of a particular data format that has been pasted or dropped on the toolbox into a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>.
If a creator handles more than one format, call <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.AddCreator%2A> more than once.
Unexpected behavior may result if you add more than one creator for the same format.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCreatorCallback"></xref> that can create a component when the toolbox item is invoked.
The data format that the creator handles.
Adds a new toolbox item creator for a specified data format and designer host.
A toolbox item creator can convert data of a particular data format that has been pasted or dropped on the toolbox into a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>.
If a creator handles more than one format, call <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.AddCreator%2A> more than once.
Unexpected behavior may result if you add more than one creator for the same format.
If the `host` parameter is set to `null`, the creator will be available to all designers.
If a designer host is supplied, the creator will only be available to designers using the specified host.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCreatorCallback"></xref> that can create a component when the toolbox item is invoked.
The data format that the creator handles.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost"></xref> that represents the designer host to associate with the creator.
Adds the specified project-linked toolbox item to the toolbox.
A linked toolbox item is a toolbox item that is only available for a specific project.
The linked <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> to add to the toolbox.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost"></xref> for the current design document.
Adds the specified project-linked toolbox item to the toolbox in the specified category.
A linked toolbox item is a toolbox item that is only available for a specific project.
The linked <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> to add to the toolbox.
The toolbox item category to add the toolbox item to.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost"></xref> for the current design document.
Adds the specified toolbox item to the toolbox.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> to add to the toolbox.
Adds the specified toolbox item to the toolbox in the specified category.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> to add to the toolbox.
The toolbox item category to add the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> to.
Gets the names of all the tool categories currently on the toolbox.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.CategoryNameCollection"></xref> containing the tool categories.
Gets a toolbox item from the specified object that represents a toolbox item in serialized form.
The object that contains the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> to retrieve.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> created from the serialized object.
Gets a toolbox item from the specified object that represents a toolbox item in serialized form, using the specified designer host.
The object that contains the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> to retrieve.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost"></xref> to associate with this <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> created from deserialization.
Gets the currently selected toolbox item.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> that is currently selected, or `null` if no toolbox item has been selected.
Gets the currently selected toolbox item if it is available to all designers, or if it supports the specified designer.

This method returns the currently selected <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> if it is not designer specific, and only returns a designer-specific currently selected <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> if the type of the designer host specified in the `host` parameter matches the type of designer that the currently selected <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> supports.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost"></xref> that the selected tool must be associated with for it to be returned.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> that is currently selected, or `null` if no toolbox item is currently selected.
Gets a collection of toolbox items from the toolbox that match the specified category.
The toolbox item category to retrieve all the toolbox items from.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCollection"></xref> that contains the current toolbox items that are associated with the specified category.
Gets the collection of toolbox items that are associated with the specified designer host and category from the toolbox.
The toolbox item category to retrieve the toolbox items from.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost"></xref> that is associated with the toolbox items to retrieve.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCollection"></xref> that contains the current toolbox items that are associated with the specified category and designer host.
Gets the entire collection of toolbox items from the toolbox.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCollection"></xref> that contains the current toolbox items.
Gets the collection of toolbox items that are associated with the specified designer host from the toolbox.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost"></xref> that is associated with the toolbox items to retrieve.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCollection"></xref> that contains the current toolbox items that are associated with the specified designer host.
Gets a value indicating whether the specified object which represents a serialized toolbox item matches the specified attributes.
The object that contains the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> to retrieve.
An <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> that contains the attributes to test the serialized object for.
`true` if the object matches the specified attributes; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether the specified object which represents a serialized toolbox item can be used by the specified designer host.
The object that contains the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> to retrieve.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost"></xref> to test for support for the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref>.
`true` if the specified object is compatible with the specified designer host; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether the specified object is a serialized toolbox item.
The object to inspect.
`true` if the object contains a toolbox item object; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether the specified object is a serialized toolbox item, using the specified designer host.
The object to inspect.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost"></xref> that is making this request.
`true` if the object contains a toolbox item object; otherwise, `false`.
Refreshes the state of the toolbox items.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.Refresh%2A> method is used to indicate to the toolbox service that the user wants to update the cache of toolbox items.
If the toolbox service maintains a live list of toolbox item containers, then this method will do nothing.
If it maintains a snapshot of toolbox item containers, calling this method should ensure that the snapshot is up to date.
Removes a previously added toolbox item creator of the specified data format.
The data format of the creator to remove.
Removes a previously added toolbox creator that is associated with the specified data format and the specified designer host.
The data format of the creator to remove.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost"></xref> that is associated with the creator to remove.
Removes the specified toolbox item from the toolbox.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> to remove from the toolbox.
Removes the specified toolbox item from the toolbox.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> to remove from the toolbox.
The toolbox item category to remove the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> from.
Gets or sets the name of the currently selected tool category from the toolbox.
The name of the currently selected category.
Notifies the toolbox service that the selected tool has been used.
Gets a serializable object that represents the specified toolbox item.
This method serializes the specified <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> to an object that can be persisted.
The returned object can be stored in a stream or passed around in a drag-and-drop or clipboard operation.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> to serialize.
An object that represents the specified <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref>.
Sets the current application's cursor to a cursor that represents the currently selected tool.
If no tool is selected, the cursor will default to the standard Windows cursor.
`true` if the cursor is set by the currently selected tool, `false` if there is no tool selected and the cursor is set to the standard windows cursor.
Selects the specified toolbox item.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> to select.
